COVID-19 negative certification required for entering the country. 

 A negative COVID-19 test issued no more than 72 hours prior to departure is required for entry. Test results must be a complete report and presented on the official letterhead of the laboratory where the test was conducted.
column3:
Quarantine requirement at government designated site.


All incoming international travelers are required to quarantine at a government-supervised facility for 21 days.

International Restrictions:
*Entry to Tonga: A State of Emergency was declared on 20 March 2020 by the government of the Kingdom of Tonga, this has been renewed until 8pm on 20 December 2021. Tongan borders are closed to entry to all foreign nationals, except if authorisation is granted by the relevant Tongan government authorities.
No international cruise ships and yachts will be granted entry into Tonga until further notice.
Some countries in the region have also introduced travel restrictions to and from the Pacific islands. You should check specifics for any countries that might be involved in your travel when planning a trip to Tonga.
*Demonstrating your COVID-19 status: Tonga will only accept the letter version of proof COVID-19 recovery and vaccination record. They will not accept digital proof. Your appointment card from vaccination centres is not designed to be used as proof of vaccination and should not be used to demonstrate your vaccine status.
*Visas: If you hold a short-term visa for Tonga which is close to expiry, you should report to the Immigration Office to have your visa extended. Further information can be found at the Ministry of Revenue &Customs website.

Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Tonga: A State of Emergency was declared on 20 March 2020 by the government of the Kingdom of Tonga. This has been renewed until 8pm on 17 January 2022. The Kingdom of Tonga has also extended the National COVID-19 Restrictions Directions until 8pm on 17 January 2022. These include a night-time curfew from midnight to 5am with the exception of New Yearâ€™s Eve, when the curfew will be from 2am to 5am on 1 January, and during National Prayer Week (3 - 7 January 2022) when the curfew will be midnight to 3am. The Declaration of a Public Health Emergency (COVID-19) Regulations 2020 and the Declaration of an Emergency Notifiable Condition has been extended to 17 January 2022.
Gatherings are restricted to 50 people at indoor venues and 100 people at outdoor venues, except for religious services and education institutions. Tongan authorities are encouraging social distancing and good hand hygiene.
*Public places and services: Public places are open including places of worship, shops, restaurants, bars and nightclubs. You must abide by the nationwide curfew and remain in your home or accommodation between midnight and 5am.
